titles.title: National Flood Insurance Program Further Enhanced Borrowing Authority Act of 2005
National Flood Insurance Program Further Enhanced Borrowing Authority Act of 2005
National Flood Insurance Program Further Enhanced Borrowing Authority Act of 2005
National Flood Insurance Program Further Enhanced Borrowing Authority Act of 2005
To temporarily increase the borrowing authority of the Federal Emergency Management Agency for carrying out the national flood insurance program.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 109-274.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 150.

action.text: Mr. Ney moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4133.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Oxley moved that the House agree to the Senate amendments.
DEBATE - Pursuant to a previous special order, the House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the motion to agree to the Senate amendments to H.R. 4133.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to by voice vote.

reference.label: text as House agreed to Senate amendment

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/21/2005--Public Law. National Flood Insurance Program Further Enhanced Borrowing Authority Act of 2005 - Amends the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 to increase from $3.5 billion to $18.5 billion, through FY2008, the total amount which the Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) may borrow from the Secretary of the Treasury with the President's approval to carry out the flood insurance program.Designates such funds as emergency spending.
